page.title: 01SUMMARY OF 3 WOLDS VILLAGES
page.content: Very rural area on Lincolnshire Wolds _ attractive rolling countryside, 130m above sea level, rising from the plain & comprising Wolds village of Ludford, hamlet of Sixhills on the edge & North Willingham at the foot of the Wolds. Population is approx: 389 and that of Ludford is declining _ 311 in 1983, 380 in 1961 and 818 in 1861, due to young people seeking work elsewhere as agricultural labour needs lessen with mechanisation. Countryside mostly arable farming, a little grazing and a few trees (many at Ludford removed for wartime airfield) so that artic winds coming off the North Sea can make it a cold place in winter but it is an attractive unspoilded area. It is bi_ sected along its length by the A631 Mrket Rasen to Louth road.
